thread.title: LSU No. 1 in the nation, per former BCS computer rankings
thread.title_full: LSU No. 1 in the nation, per former BCS computer rankings | NOLA.com

author: Jerit Roser, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: LSU No. 1 in the nation, per former BCS computer rankings
text:
LSU climbed to No. 5 in the AP and coaches' polls this week after a 35-28 defeat of Florida in a top-10 matchup.
But the last undefeated SEC team standing is the top team in the country, according to the old BCS computers, now called the College Football Computer Composite rankings and looked at weekly by USA Today .
The Tigers jumped 10 spots this week to edge Utah for the No. 1 spot in the rankings, from which TCU slipped after struggling some into the third quarter with 20-point underdog Iowa State before pulling away to a 45-21 win.
Each of the five formulas combined in the rankings had a different No. 1 team: LSU in Peter Wolfe's, Utah in Wes Colley's, Alabama in Jeff Sagarin's, Baylor in Ken Massey's and Michigan State in Richard Billingsley's.
Ohio State, Michigan State, Alabama, TCU, Baylor, Clemson, Iowa and Florida round out the top 10 in the composite rankings
